sentence.Network_en: Al facetiously described himself as the Last Angry Man.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿尔戏称自己为“最后的怒汉”。

sentence.Network_en: The house had been facetiously named by some waggish officer.
sentence.Network_cn: 这房子是由某个机智幽默的军官命名的。

sentence.Network_en: I sometimes facetiously place the cause of it all to Charley Furuseth's credit.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有时候也曾将起因全部可笑地推在却利?福罗萨的身上.

list.abs: as if the poor parson had said a rarely facetious thing ., 好像这个可怜的人刚刚说了什么可笑的事情.
She kept interrupting our discussion with facetious remarks ., 她不断用开玩笑的话干扰我们的讨论.
I became angry with the little boy at his facetious remarks .我对这个小男孩过分的玩笑变得发火了。
facetiae 诙谐书，淫书facetious story 滑稽故事facsimile 传真版

" Of course , wait a moment . " Claud smiled , " The champion would not mind coaching the beginner . " He was used to speak to Carl in a confident and facetious tone .“当然，我马上就来。”小伙子给了同伴一个微笑，“冠军是不会介意指导初学者的。”他习惯于用这种自信和幽默的口吻与卡尔调侃。

entry.tran: (不分场合)乱开玩笑的，贫嘴的
entry.def: If you say that someone is being facetious, you are criticizing them because they are making humorous remarks or saying things that they do not mean in a situation where they ought to be serious.

example.ex: The woman eyed him coldly. 'Don't be facetious,' she said.
example.tran: 妇人冷冷地看着他，说道：“别没正经了。”

auth_sentence.content: Just don't touch the hair, Guido said, facetiously.
auth_sentence.res_content: Just don't touch the hair, Guido said, facetiously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Just don't touch the hair, Guido said, facetiously.

auth_sentence.content: Einstein rejected this view, semi-facetiously asking a friend, Does the moon exist only when I look at it?

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Einstein rejected this view, semi-facetiously asking a friend, Does the moon exist only when I look at it?

auth_sentence.content: Once, on being asked why he had become a writer, Greene replied, perhaps facetiously, that there seemed nothing else to do.
auth_sentence.res_content: Once, on being asked why he had become a writer, Greene replied, perhaps facetiously, that there seemed nothing else to do.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Once, on being asked why he had become a writer, Greene replied, perhaps facetiously, that there seemed nothing else to do.
